title: [TE] New RCA flow
body:
PR for the new RCA flow that was bug bashed by the Thirdeye Team 7/18-7/25

### new routes
- rca
- rca/metrics
- rca/events
- rca/dimensions

### redux store's state (all include actions, reducer and container component)
- `Metrics`
- `Dimensions`
- `Events`
- `Primary Metric`

### components: 
- `anomaly-graph` (wrapped around `ember-c3`)
- `events-table` (wrapped around `ember-models-table`)
- `events-header`
- `contribution-table`
- `dimension-heatmap`
- `dimension-summary`

title: Suppress unnecessary log for partition aware routing builder.
body:
When the retention manager deletes the segment and all servers are marked as offline
for a specific segment, the partition aware routing builder emits unnecessary logs
indicating that no server is found for the segment. However, this log is for the case
when the segment is valid while all servers are not available. Adding check in the
external view change update fixes this problem.

title: Fix FileNotFoundException when uploading multiple segments with same name
body:
The reason for the exception is as followings:
1. Two POST requests trying to upload segment with the same name
2. Before one thread try to move the file, the other one delete the file

The fix is that, always use unique path for each uploaded segment.

title: On-Heap implementation of immutable StringDictionary.
body:
The call to StringDictionary.get()/indexOf() is expensive because it has
to pad/unpad the string, create new String from byte[], perform binary
search etc. This is done in the order of numDocsScanned, per query.
It can take > 30% of server side latency if numDocsScanned is of the
order of several tens of thousands or more (99th percentile).

For String columns with very low cardinality, we can simply build an
on-heap dictionary using array + map at the time of loading segment.
This gets rid of the padding/unpadding, binary search, as well as
eliminates all temporary String creation.

Added field in IndexingConfig to specify (String) columns for which
on-heap dictionary should be loaded.

Added unit tests for the new code.

title: Bug fix for inconsistent padding removal between api's in StringDictionary.
body:
In StringDictionary, the api get() returns a string where only
the trailing padding characters are removed, whereas, the api
readStringValues() returns a string where the string is stripped after
the first occurrence of padding character.

Made the behavior consistent between both api's (ie remove trailing
padding characters only).

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: [TE] Fix filter values are not shown completely for non-additive dataset
body:
Problem:
Many filter values are not shown for non-additive dataset. The issue is that we add pre-aggregated keywords to the filter set (e.g., count=all) when we construct the query for non-additive dataset. However, the count(*) queries, which are used for retrieving meta-data such as filter values, should not have any setting regarding the filter set. Otherwise, the results may be incomplete.

Fix:
Before we append the decorated filterset, we check if the target of the query is '*'. If it is, then we don't add decorated filter set to the query and hence we get the complete meta-data (i.e., the filter values).

Test:
Local dashboard.

title: [TE] Allow job status checking for detection jobs
body:
During the onboard process, one missing component is the ability to check the replay execution status. After function set-up, the replay is triggered. A detection job is triggered, and tasks are generated to perform analyses. The front-end then can check the status through this end-point to get the status of the job. Once the job is COMPLETED, the alerts or the auto-tune can be triggered afterward. 

- Enable detection jobs to return job ids

- Implement an endpoint to check the job status

title: Fix the bug where deleting HLC realtime table throws ZK exception
body:
When we delete a HLC table, we first remove segments from property store, then drop the table
When removing segments, after we remove the IN_PROGRESS one, controller will automatically assign a new one because table is still alive, which cause ZK failed to remove the parent node.

The fix is that:
Whenever we drop a table (OFFLINE/REALTIME), we should first drop the table from Helix, then clean up the state in property store or disk

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: Added new priority based scheduler for multi-tenancy support
body:
Added resource management policy, bounded executor service and
priority based schedulers to provide better scheduling and
isolation between different tenants.
* Default behavior is the legacy FCFS approach with no resource limitations
* Supports configurable resource allocation policy per query
* Bounded executor service limits the threads used for a query to the limit
set of resource manager without changes to query processing logic.
* Priority Token Bucket scheduler implements a multi-level query scheduler
that prioritizes queries from a scheduler group with highest tokens. For groups
with same tokens, the group with least committed resources is selected for scheduling.
A group is not allowed to exceed the configured hard limit on the number of threads.

title: Avoid expensive String.format for non-double values.
body:
For group-by responses with > 20k groups it seems upto 25% of the query
latency is just spent formatting doubles while generating response.
This can be avoided in cases where we know that the result is a whole
number (especially when column data type was short/int/long).

A cleaner change would be for servers to send response in appropriate
data type, and broker to upcast to the most appropriat data type. But
that needs quite a bit of changes. This PR is a band-aid until we have a
clean fix.

title: Fix the bug where dropping a HLC table will throw NPE
body:
The reason for the NPE is that:
1. We first drop the table config, then remove the Helix resource. When we rebuild IdealState, it accesses the table config, which will be null at that time.
2. In the handleChildChange callback, when parentPath get removed, currentChildren will be null.

Updated RealtimeClusterIntegrationTest to test dropRealtimeTable() (also tested in HybridClusterIntegrationTest)

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: Optimize redundant adds into fixed size priority queue for topN computation.
body:
The current code to compute topN adds elements into priority queue
unconditionally, only to de-queue immediately if queue size exceeds N.
One optimization here is to compare the new element against top of the
queue, and add only if it is better than the top value. Doing so
provides about 10% latency improvement for cases with large number of
groups (100k groups or more, before pruning).

title: WIP: Setup jersey based controller admin application
body:
This sets up basic framework for migrating controller APIs to jersey based
REST application. ControllerAdminApiApplication is the basic ResourceConfig
class that sets up the application, configures swagger resources and starts
web application. All existing restlet APIs are copied to api.resources folder
and only TableSchemaResource is modified to Jersey based framework. This commit
configures the binder module in ControllerStarter to inject controller objects in
rest resources. This also sets up constants, success response and WebApplicationMapper
to map API exceptions to json responses.

title: Adding default aggregation function as a metric field, so that we don't always default to SUM
body:
In thirdeye we've defaulted to using sum everywhere in metric functions. We want to be able to support max, count etc in data fetches. This PR will enable us to set a default agg function for a metric
After this PR, we should extend this feature to be able to get in the agg function as input from the front end interfaces. While it is okay to have a default agg function for metrics, the agg function should be independent of the metric, and we should be able to apply any agg function on any metric at runtime.

title: Avoid creation of byte[] during DataTable deserialization.
body:
During deserialization of DataTable, we create new byte[] and copy out
bytes from a ByteBuffer, and then wrap byte[] into a ByteBuffer for
deserialization. This change eliminates the creation of temporary byte[]
and its wrapping into ByteBuffer by directly slicing out a new
ByteBuffer from the original ByteBuffer.

While the total number of objects created does not reduce, creation of
byte[] and data copy is replaced by creation of shallow ByteBuffer
slices.

title: Implement an endpoint that surfaces the baseline calculated by anomaly functions
body:
1. Add an end-point that can surface the baseline from anomaly functions to the user interface, even though no anomalies are detected. Normally, the baseline from anomaly functions can be surfaced when there is an anomaly. But if user wants to know the baseline information, there is no way to surface that yet. This endpoint can help thirdeye surface the baseline from anomaly functions to users.

2. Unify the baseline calculation in the AnomaliesResource, so that both AnomalyDetail and the new end-point use the same function to calculate the baseline values.

class to allocate memory.

title: Refactor and optimize all integration tests (part 1)
body:
1. Added ClusterIntegrationTestUtils for all commonly used utils for cluster integration tests
2. Modified BaseClusterIntegrationTest to make it the base for all cluster integration test, and make most settings configurable
3. Move all commonly used tests into BaseClusterIntegrationTestSet
4. Merged DefaultColumnsClusterIntegrationTest, DefaultColumnsTriggerClusterIntegrationTest, InstanceDecommissionIntegrationTest, InvertedIndexOfflineIntegrationTest, MultipleNodeOfflineClusterIntegrationTest, NoDictionaryIntegrationTest into the OfflineClusterIntegrationTest
5. Merge InvertedIndexRealtimeIntegrationTest into RealtimeIntegrationTest
6. Removed the following tests that test nothing: FileBasedSentineTest, FlightsHybridClusterScanComparisonIntegrationTest, LLCPartitioningIntegrationTest, RealtimeSchemaChangeIntegrationTest
7. Refactored and optimized all other tests to use the new base and util classes

title: [TE] filter-select component
body:
### What's new: 
Added a `filter-select` component that wraps around `power-select-multiple`. 
The default `power-select-multiple` component currently doesn't support lazy loading rendering; In thirdeye, the filter search can potentially return more than 1000 items, and this can take more than 15 sec to render. 

The `filter-select` component uses ember-concurrency's task to debounce searches and display result by group if a group has less than 25 items or the total search has less than 100 items (customizable) 

### Usage: 

```
{{filter-select
    options=metricFilters  // (required)  
    selected=filters  // (required) JSON filters (from endpoint)
    maxNumFilters=25  // (optional {default: 25}) max number of filters per group
    maxTotalFilters=100  // (optional {default:100}) max number of filters for the search
}}
```
